buffer_pool.h File Reference

Detailed Description

Host Driver: A driver-generated pool of buffers that it can use for dynamic memory allocation.

Definition in file buffer_pool.h.

Go to the source code of this file.

Function Documentation

uint8_t* get_buffer_from_pool ( void *  pdev,
int  size 
)

Get a buffer from the pool.

Parameters:
pdev - pointer to the octeon device.
size - size of buffer to be allocated.
The buffer pool thats a best fit for the buffer size is checked for an available buffer. If not, then the next higher size buffer pool is checked. If no buffers are available, a buffer is dynamically allocated and if that fails, no buffer is returned.

Returns:
Success: buffer pointer; Failure: NULL

Referenced by cavium_alloc_buffer().

void octeon_delete_buffer_pool ( octeon_device_t *  octeon_dev  ) 

Delete the buffer pool.

Parameters:
octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device.
Delete the buffers in the buffer pool at module unload time.

uint32_t octeon_init_buffer_pool ( octeon_device_t *  octeon_dev,
octeon_bufpool_config_t *  bufpool_conf 
)

Initialize the buffer pool.

Parameters:
octeon_dev - pointer to the octeon device.
bufpool_conf - Configuration to be used to initialize
The buffer pool is allocated according to chunk size and chunk count mentioned in bufpool_conf for each pool. There is a separate buffer pool for each device.

Returns:
Success: 0; Failure: 1.

void put_buffer_in_pool ( void *  dev,
uint8_t *  b 
)

Put a buffer back into the buffer pool.

Parameters:
dev - pointer to the octeon device.
b - the buffer to be released to the pool.
